supersolids.tools.simulate_case¶

Animation for the numerical solver for the non-linear time-dependent Schrodinger equation for 1D, 2D and 3D in single-core.

Module Contents¶

Functions¶

simulate_case(System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, Anim: supersolids.Animation.Animation.Animation, accuracy: float = 10**(-6), delete_input: bool = True, dir_path: pathlib.Path = Path.home().joinpath('supersolids', 'results'), slice_indices: numpy.ndarray = [0, 0, 0], offscreen: bool = False, x_lim: Tuple[(float, float)] = (-1.0, 1.0), y_lim: Tuple[(float, float)] = (-1.0, 1.0), z_lim: Tuple[(float, float)] = (-1.0, 1.0), steps_per_npz: int = 10, frame_start: int = 0) → supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger

Wrapper for Animation and Schroedinger to get a working Animation
supersolids.tools.simulate_case.simulate_case(System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, Anim: supersolids.Animation.Animation.Animation, accuracy: float = 10 ** - 6, delete_input: bool = True, dir_path: pathlib.Path = Path.home().joinpath('supersolids', 'results'), slice_indices: numpy.ndarray = [0, 0, 0], offscreen: bool = False, x_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (- 1.0, 1.0), y_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (- 1.0, 1.0), z_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (- 1.0, 1.0), steps_per_npz: int = 10, frame_start: int = 0) → supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger[source]¶

Wrapper for Animation and Schroedinger to get a working Animation of a System through the equations given by Schroedinger.

Parameters

  • System – Schrödinger equations for the specified system

  • Anim –

    class

    Animation with configured properties

  • accuracy – Convergence is reached when relative error of mu is smaller than accuracy, where \(\mu = - \log(\psi_{normed}) / (2 dt)\)

  • offscreen – Condition for interactive mode. When camera functions are used, then interaction is not possible. So interactive=True turn the usage of camera functions off.

  • delete_input – Condition if the input pictures should be deleted, after creation the creation of the animation as e.g. mp4

  • dir_path – Path where to look for old directories (movie data)

  • slice_indices – Numpy array with indices of grid points in the directions x, y, z (in terms of System.x, System.y, System.z) to produce a slice/plane in mayavi, where \(\psi_{prob}\) = \(|\psi|^2\) is used for the slice Max values is for e.g. System.Res.x - 1.

  • x_lim – Limits of plot in x direction

  • y_lim – Limits of plot in y direction

  • z_lim – Limits of plot in z direction

Returns

Referenz to Schroedinger System
